Class ColorScale

Implement a 256 elements color scale with static data as readonly array of sRGB truples and interpolation method to get color from scale as a double.

ColorScale((Double, Double, Double)[])

Create the color scale from color data

Declaration
public ColorScale((double, double, double)[] colorData)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.ValueTuple<System.Double, System.Double, System.Double>[] colorData

An array of 256 truples of double, with each component being between 0 and 1
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

colorData can't be null
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException

colorData must have exactly 256 elements, with all elements components being between 0 and 1

GetColor(Double, Boolean)

Get the color corresponding to the given position on the scale through interpolation

Declaration
public Color GetColor(double position, bool inverse = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Double position

The position on the scale
System.Boolean inverse

If true, return the Windows.UI.Color corresponding to the inversed color scale (Optional ; Default : false)
Returns
Type Description
Windows.UI.Color

The color
Remarks

position is a percentage and must be between 0 and 1.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException

position Must be in the [0 , 1] range
